intro: Stigmaphyllon sundaicum, commonly known as the Sunda stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
